case_vignette: Three days after undergoing laparoscopic colectomy, a 67-year-old man reports swelling and pain in his right leg. He was diagnosed with colon cancer 1 month ago. His temperature is 38.5°C (101.3°F). Physical examination shows swelling of the right leg from the ankle to the thigh. There is no erythema or rash.
question: Which  is likely to be most helpful in establishing the diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have swelling and pain in my right leg, from my ankle up to my thigh.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms for three days.
Do you have a personal or family history of blood clotting disorders?
The case vignette doesn't provide that information.
Do you take any medications or have any medical conditions?
I was diagnosed with colon cancer a month ago.
Are you currently receiving any treatment for colon cancer?
I underwent a laparoscopic colectomy.
**Final Diagnosis:** Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT)
